content.title: Embolic Protection in Renal Artery Intervention
content.description: Use of embolic protection devices during renal artery stenting to prevent atheroembolic injury to renal parenchyma.

rationale.problem: Atherosclerotic debris may embolize during stenting
rationale.consequence: Cholesterol emboli cause progressive renal damage

clinical_evidence.benefit: Reduction in captured debris, unclear clinical benefit

technique.deployment: Cross lesion, deploy filter, then intervene

content.clinical_pearl: Consider embolic protection in high-risk lesions (severely calcified, ulcerated) even if routine benefit uncertain
